section.title: Find Package Sources
section.para: OBS is adding informations to each created package about the origin of the sources. This information get stored in the DISTURL tag of an rpm, which can be displayed as followed rpm -q --queryformat '%{DISTURL}\n' glibc rpm -q --queryformat '%{DISTURL}\n' -p glibc-2.1.0-1.i586.rpm The disturl can look like this: obs://build.opensuse.org/openSUSE:Factory/standard/80d21fdd2299302358246d757b4d8c4f-glibc It always starts with obs://. The second part is the name of the build instance, which is usually also the webui. Next comes the project name and the repository name where the binary got built. Last part is the source md5 sum and the package name.
The disturl can be entered also in the search field of the web interface of the build service.
